content.data: You can choose options by left clicking them with your mouse. You also can use the mouse to draw or to select objects on the screen. With a two-button mouse, the left button is the select button used to select objects on the screen. The right button typically displays a shortcut menu.
The mouse provides feedback to Solid regarding a variety of functions. Although a Scroll Wheel Mouse is optional, it is highly recommended. The functions are listed below:

Click to select objects 
 
 
 Drag to select multiple objects in 2D Views 
 
 
 Drag to Rotate the View in 3D Views 
 
 
 Click to specify locations

A Scroll Wheel Mouse is typically a two-button mouse with a small wheel between the buttons. The left and right buttons behave the same as they do on a standard mouse. You can rotate the wheel by discrete values. You can use the wheel to zoom and pan in your drawing without using any Solid tools.
The following table lists the mouse actions supported with a Scroll Wheel Mouse in Solid.

rows: Rotate the wheel forward to Zoom In, backward to Zoom Out.
